words.def: equipped with wire or wires especially for electric or telephone service
having great (or a certain) extent from one side to the other
ligament made of metal and used to fasten things or make cages or fences etc
a low dam built across a stream to raise its level or divert its flow
a journey in a vehicle (usually an automobile)
the fourth day of the week
water that has condensed on a cool surface overnight from water vapor in the air
a small cube with 1 to 6 spots on the six faces
An old Portuguese money of account .
a state in the Rocky Mountains
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
